pr_title: Add integration tests for explode mode of spring boot jar

timeline.message: exploded mode for spring boot fat jar
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:GoogleContainerTools/jib into cli-spring-boot-expl
fix NoSuchElementException when layers.idx includes a layer with no files listed
Add integration testing for layered and non-layered springboot jars
Merge branch 'cli-spring-boot-expl' of github.com:GoogleContainerTools/jib into spring-boot-integration-tests

timeline.bodyText: How are these spring boot jars constructed? They don't seem like an actual jar built from a Spring Boot project. (Usually it runs a server listening on port 8080).
timeline.author: chanseokoh

replies.bodyText: Great question! To create the jars, I downloaded the demo project from https://start.spring.io/ and ran ./mvnw package. Although, I just realized that I'm currently asserting on System.out instead of actually testing if the desired output shows up on localhost:8080 after having run SpringApplication.run() -- which is probably not a sign of a good test for a spring boot application. I'll correct this.
replies.author: mpeddada1

replies.bodyText:
Hmm... yeah. It looked weird that a Spring Boot app prints Hello World and quits. Do the tests actually pass?
We have similar Spring Boot integration tests, For example, take a look at
https://github.com/GoogleContainerTools/jib/blob/master/jib-gradle-plugin/src/integration-test/java/com/google/cloud/tools/jib/gradle/SpringBootProjectIntegrationTest.java
replies.author: chanseokoh

timeline.message: use test projects for spring-boot tests
modify target image name in test

timeline.bodyText: Hmm... I'm curious. Does it not work without toAbsolutePath()?
timeline.author: chanseokoh

replies.bodyText: Ah good catch. toAbsolutePath() doesn't make a difference
replies.author: mpeddada1

timeline.bodyText: This will not run if one of the assertions above fail or some code throws an exception. Put it in finally, or @After public tearDown() as done in other tests.
timeline.author: chanseokoh

timeline.bodyText: Nit: I'd put this before docker run so that you don't run docker run if jib jar fails for some reason.
timeline.author: chanseokoh
chanseokoh
chanseokoh

timeline.bodyText:
I wish we had a way to share test utility classes across all projects. But let's not try to resolve this in this PR.
@loosebazooka
